comments.text:
[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Great spot, ask the cars, they will all be going down the mountain. The only problem you might encounter is the fact that the cars will be very packed going down
Parking near Tataka center

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Needed to go to Keelung, was picked up very quickly despite this tough stretch. Cars have a lot of place to stop and can see you from far away. There’s also a red light not far so cars will have to slow down
we hitch here to Taroko gorge, catch a ride, sleepover, tour of interesting places nearby and a lot of free food. one of the best hitches of the life

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

My friend and I went on our separate ways, despite the fact that this was a turn, a car quickly stopped for me

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Got dropped off here, excellent spot to continue hitchhiking to the north. There’s a lot of space and cars see you from far away. I hitchhiked in the middle of a random day

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Really random place to hitchhike from but it works to get back to the city centre

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Barely waited on this road. I was visible from far away and the cars had place to stop. Got a direct lift to Taidong (everyone going on this road are passing there anyway)

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

This small island is super hitchhikeable. This was my go to spot to get to the other side of the island. Hitchhiking anywhere on the big road that goes around the island is also definitely gonna work, you just gotta wait for people to pass (small island but quite touristic, so it’s all about luck). My hitchhiking experience on this island was extremely good!

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Waited very little time and got picked up by a guy who brought us to Pingdong. This was towards the end of a workday

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Got dropped off here by a very nice Taiwanese family and got almost immediately picked up by a group of friends headed to the same destination as me, Kaohsiung

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Was around 8 pm, there was basically no one left, this guy on his motorbike brought me to a more frequented road to keep going south

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Honestly very good spot, and I think on this road it would be pretty much good anywhere. Stand on the piece of grass between the fast lanes and the side lane. That will make you seen from far away and you’ll be safe too. In the best case, try to have a truck of some sort of works on the lane next to where you stand, that way cars driving on that lane will be driving slower 😎

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Great spot, you’re on the main road, there’s a traffic light so cars will be slower, and there’s enough space for you to stand and be safe. Most people will probably go to Kaohsiung or pass it. Told you Taiwan is amazing to hitchhike

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

This is a very famous spot in Taiwan so you’ll most definitely find some people to help you bring back on the main road

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Great spot, barely waited. Had a sign with written « south on it ». You gotta talk with people to see where you wanna be dropped, I had to go to the absolute south of the island so some logistics as to where to be dropped was required

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

There’s not many cars who take this road (but probably more than what you’re thinking), so the cars are gonna feel very responsible if they don’t help you get further. We got dropped at this parking where we then walked to do the paperwork before being allowed to climb on Yushan

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Barely waited in the scolding sun of the midday, an older couple helped me get to Huoyanshan

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Made friends with some people on my tour and they brought me to this restaurant

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Amazing spot to get on the highway, I hitched a ride to Hsinchu before the bus going to Hsinchu had a chance to arrive!
I found the spot on hitchhiking but no one marks here! the triangle spot going to highway 1 is the only way to the north. It is the best spot to go north
8am on a Friday
Great spot to Taitung
Easy to get pickup to hualien city
Easy spot to get pickup to taitung city directions.
There is a bus stop and people ride slowly there. Got an easy ride further north.
nice spot and people going to north

This is a great visible spot because the cars head to the highway already going north, and if you change your mind and choose to take public transportation instead, the bus stop is just a few meters away.

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Great spot to get to Taipei! Cars have a bit of space, and won’t hesitate to stop (especially annoying and insistent taxis)

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

We stood there longer than what I expected, considering the great visibility, enough place for cars to stop, next to a 7/11. Me and my friend eventually got picked up by this car that was already way too full

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Hitchhiked with a friend, around 8:30-9 am on a workday. In Taiwan you can stand on the side of pretty much any road and you’ll guaranteed be picked up

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Was my go to spot to hitchhike north of Taidong. Against all odds this is a really great place to hitchhike (before or on the bridge itself). There’s quite a lot of cars too so waiting times are really short

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Asked all the cars that stopped at this convenience store and stood with my sign (east side) on the side of the road for a bit. My previous driver helped me ask around as he was stressed for me

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Barely got dropped here that a couple decided to help me get to my destination (but not before reproaching my previous driver that they don’t bring me up to where I’m going)

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Good spot to go to Anping. Used this spot twice and both times waited very little time before I got picked up. Both times happened in the middle of a workday

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Hitchhiked there when it was dark and quite late but I still got picked up quite quickly and brought a bit more south on this road. From experience, if the Taiwanese people aren’t going to your exact spot they might not offer to take you further on the road, so make sure to assure that it’s gonna help you a lot

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Once again needed to get to a super specific place and got picked up very quickly

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Was trying to get to a super precise place and got picked up rather quickly (that’s an average experience hitchhiking in Taiwan)

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Hitchhiked once to see the island, I would say this island is also super good to hitchhike on, but again there are very few cars driving around (and it’s probably a motorbike that will pick you up)

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

This whole island is super hitchhikeable, you can start from pretty much anywhere. You gotta be careful with the fact that many places are empty and that the frequency of cars is very low. But when you see a car you almost have the guarantee it will pick you up

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Quick and easy ride to go to Baishawan. When the boat comes back from Orchid island there’s many cars so it’s very quick (my case)

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable!

Very good spot to hitchhike south (and very likely north as well). Did it twice, both in the middle of random days and both times it was very easy to get picked up

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

It was night so not a good visibility where I stood. There were constructions happening so that didn’t help safety wise, and cars can go quite fast even if there is a red light. Thankfully got picked up relatively quickly

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Don’t bother taking the expensive buses or train to Alishan, this road is perfectly hitchhikeable! I barely waited and a guy picked me up and brought me quite high on the road. Then I also quickly got picked up by a family who let me join their family hike before bringing me to the recreational parc of Alishan

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Best spot to hitchhike out of Lugang going south in my opinion. Not hard to walk to from the city centre, good visibility and cars aren’t going too fast

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Found a guy who took me to Lugang. Quite easy and good spot, road going straight to the highway 1, many cars and great visibility

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

I didn’t make it easy for people to stop for me: my sign said Lugang (which was quite far from here and very precise), this road has quite a lot of traffic, and there were constructions happening, rendering it sometimes hard to hitchhike while there’s a truck backing in front of me. A lady on her motorcycle still managed to bring me more west, which greatly helped me. She offered to host me if I

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Really random spot but every random place in Taiwan is very hitchhikeable, and this spot really isn’t great for place to spot, visibility and probability that a car goes where you’re going but the willingness of Taiwanese to help you is greater than anything you can imagine. Got picked up by a motorcycle

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

This is a great spot to hitchhike to the mountain. Because of the earthquake that year it wasn’t possible to cross over to the east, but it usually is possible. You have a 7-11 there and the cars see you from far away

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

A student picked me up and brought me there in a record time as I was pretty much in the city centre. Really great spot as this road leads you to the highway

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Managed to find someone willing to drive me to Taichung. Amazing time considering how much in the inner city I was

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

A guy saw my recently written sign and offered me a ride to my desired place and even tried to buy me some snacks

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Second car that passed this not very used road picked me up to Beidong

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Was walking on this road to get closer to the highway but decided to hitchhike at the same time. A lady picked me up on this road already and brought me to my destination in Taichung

[Did this back in 2024]
Don’t trust the few dots in Taiwan, this country is super hitchhikeable! 

Very good spot, this is the road leading to the highway so most people will go through this spot. We were standing at the wrong road (there’s many on the map as you can see), but some nice Taiwanese went up to us and corrected us
Dont remember exactly where we stand but somewhere around this point
didn't get a ride here, probably because people are not going out of the city
quite good to free way

Good spot for going south, i got a ride to Taichung after 15 minutes. There is not really a lot of space for cars to pull over, but it's just before a traffic light so they will manage to stop for you :)
Took Yongning MRT and then walked over to this spot. I was picked up in maybe 3 minutes.
